subject: p12475198
History: Dual-chamber ICD implant. External pacemaker removed.
Impression: AP chest compared to : A right transsubclavian right atrial pacer and right ventricular pacer defibrillator leads in standard placements, no pneumothorax, pleural effusion or mediastinal widening. Previous mild pulmonary edema has improved, moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly has not. There may be a new small left pleural effusion. Conventional radiographs recommended when feasible for further evaluation.
